meanings.definition: The state of being dependent on or interconnected with other things.
meanings.sent1: The relativity of the situation made it clear that we needed to work together.
meanings.sent2: The relativity of the ecosystem shows how every living thing is connected.
meanings.sent3: The relativity of our schedules led to a comical mix-up at the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The relativity of opinions in the group created a harmonious discussion.
meanings.sent5: The relativity of emotions can impact our decisions more than we realize.

meanings.definition: The theory of physics that describes the relationship between time, space, and motion.
meanings.sent1: Learning about relativity in class helped me understand the universe better.
meanings.sent2: Einstein's theory of relativity revolutionized our understanding of the cosmos.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity about relativity led to a playful exploration of the room.
meanings.sent4: The relativity of time can feel different depending on our experiences.
meanings.sent5: Studying relativity can open up a whole new world of possibilities in science.
